channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road overwhelmed with traffic, 7th December
item.description:
Robert Burns Avenue cannot cope with the volumes of traffic that it has to handle at school drop-off and pick-up times. We routinely see a queue of cars at these times, stationary, waiting to get through the mess. The result is a build up of fumes just at the times when our children are there in numbers. It amounts to a public health hazard as well as the risk to people from manoeuvring vehicles. Please consider closing the road to cars at these times and improving infrastructure for active travel.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 65 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 12 inch potholes, 7th December
item.description:
There needs to be an inspection of GL51 6NU so that you can fill in NUMEROUS and large developing potholes that have appeared (RE-APPEARED) at the same time. Some are in the carriageway whereas others are on the speedbumps. The one I am reporting is approx 12inchs long by maybe 4inchs wide and looks deep and is midway between the first and second speedbump from the Bibury Rd junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Robert Burns Avenue, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street in general state of disrepair, 4th December
item.description:
For the two years I've lived here this road is by far one of the worst I've seen. Its bad enough being as narrow as it is without the added extra potholes. Poor patchwork has taken place here too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 61 Saint Paul's Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes including one very deep one, 3rd December
item.description:

item.title: Vehicle with Trailer parked on double yellow lines., 3rd December

item.title: Double Mattress Flytipped at Location, 2nd December
item.description:
The Location is on the Whittington Road just past the Burnt Oak crossroads (note the broken road sign - two years now!) The Mattress is in a small laybye just past the crossroads on the left hand side. Please can it be removed please.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: GX14 KGG White peugeot abandoned outside No2 Appleton Aveneue for 2 days. Poorly parked, 2nd December
item.description:
No idea who the car belongs to and is causing access issues for home owners in the avenue. Can the owner be identified and the vehicle removed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Appleton Avenue, The Reddings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle parked dangerously on corner on double yellow lines, 2nd December
item.description:
Daily occurrence of vehicles parking on the corner, blocking visibility for road users and causing regular bear-miss crashes. Please renew yellow lines to deter these people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Cudnall Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
